Graduation Update:

We received updated guidelines from the Texas Education Agency this week about how to safely hold commencement ceremonies. The TEA guidelines, as well as the executive order from the Governor, state that outdoor graduations can be held in all counties in Texas starting on June 1st as long as certain safety guidelines are followed, which could include spaced seating, sanitizing stations, face mask requirements, and possible ticket limitations. Per the TEA, be advised, this permission is subject to change as underlying public health conditions change. We can now share the following information regarding Boerne ISD commencement ceremonies.

Graduation dates for Boerne ISD will be moved to June 4th (Boerne - Samuel V. Champion High School) and June 5th (Boerne High School). The ceremonies will still be held at Boerne ISD Stadium at 8pm. Boerne ISD will need to continue to comply with state and local guidelines regarding public gatherings.

For more info please click here: https://www.boerneisd.net/UpdatedGraduationDates

GRADUATION UPDATE:

Boerne ISD has formed a committee to explore ways to safely hold commencement ceremonies for both Boerne - Samuel V. Champion High School and Boerne High School, currently scheduled for May 21st and 22nd respectively (Subject to change based on COVID-19).

We will be receiving guidelines from the Texas Education Agency, and are working with local officials from Kendall County and the city of Boerne. As of this point, the TEA has not issued guidelines for in-person graduation ceremonies.

Boerne ISD will need to continue to comply with state and local guidelines regarding public gatherings, which may include a limit of attendees, as well as performing social distancing. We are exploring many options, including in-person and virtual ceremonies. As always, our number one priority is the safety of our students and families.

Once we have more information, including the dates, times and locations of possible ceremonies, we will inform the BISD community. We look forward to honoring the class of 2020! Thank you for your patience.

March 17 at 1:05 AM ·

As a precautionary measure to limit the spread of the coronavirus, the Boerne Education Foundation has decided to postpone our Rock On fundraiser planned for Saturday, March 28, 2020. The decision to postpone our event was not taken lightly and included the guidance of city officials, The Texas Department of State Health Services, The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and our Boerne Education Foundation Board of Directors. Ultimately, the health, safety and well-being of our guests, event staff and volunteers is, and always will be, our primary concern. In the next few weeks, we will announce the new date on our Boerne Education Foundation Facebook page. If you have a question or concern, please email yvette.reyna@boerneisd.net.

Thank you for your understanding and continuous support of student success in Boerne ISD.

Sincerely,
Jason Roller, President and the BEF Board of Directors

post_text: Our Showcase of Innovation for February features a new initiative at Mark T. Voss Middle School to engage student learning and encourage Friday attendance. SOAR Days at Voss have the school opening its doors to community professionals to encourage curiosity in students in their respected field of work. Past SOAR Day volunteers include those in fields ranging from professional athletes, medical experts, marketing professionals to exterminators, motivational speakers and even Voss' students themselves.
